entry.def: [ɫɑ˖xəx] Notes: shell duck.
[ɫoorən] [?] Notes: split hoof of an ungulate.
Notes: a handle on a door or any instrument for raising or lowering.
[ɫɑṉɑṉ / ɫɑnɑinʹənʹ] Notes: couples. Same as cupal.
[ɫɤ:ɣ] Notes: calf of a cow or deer.
[ɫɤ:mẹnʹ] Notes: moths.
[nə lɑʔiçən] Notes: the days.
[lɛɑbəɫɤ̈ɤ̈ç] Notes: womb of a cow.
[lʹɛ̣vɑ˖n] Notes: elm tree.
Notes: a half size pipe.
[ɫɛɛrds] Notes: lairds.
[əlʹikʹɑ̣˖lʹ] Notes: milking a cow.
[lẹ:rsinʹ] Quotation: “Bheil thu call do leirsinn?” Notes: sight.
Quotation: “Ciamar tha thu ’léirsinn ’s an dorchadas?” Notes: to see.
[lʹeo̜ɡəṉ] Notes: a lion.
[lʹẹomən] Notes: a moth.
[ljɑs] Quotation: “Chan ’eil mi léirsinn lias.”
[ə lʹiuṉəxəɣ] Notes: becoming inflamed, becoming inflected.
[ɫɔ̣nẹdʹ] Notes: plunger used in a long narrow churn.
[ɫɔ̣sɡəṉ] Notes: sledge for drawing stone [sic] behind a horse.
[luəxẹrʹ] Notes: rushes.
[ɫuə [?], ɫuəʔəɣ] Notes: noun and genitive of luadh ‘ashes’. [NOTES: slipped under ‘luath’.]
[luʔɑ˖r] Notes: chimney stack inside the house.
[ɫux bliiɑn] Notes: part of the animal directly above thigh.
[ɫuxk-loʔə] Notes: lawyers and solicitors.
[ɫuiç nən trii beuṉ] [NOTES: slipped under ‘luibh nan tri beann’.]
[ɫɯ̟irə] Notes: leprosy.
[ɫɯ̟irəx] Notes: leper.
[ɫuij] Notes: the hock of a cow’s leg.
[ɫuirɡiçɑn] Notes: the rope between the wall fastening and the halter round the cow’s neck. There was a swivel between it and the halter.
[luiçəxrɛs] Notes: meadowsweet.
[ɫurəɡən] Notes: shin.
[mɛdʹəɣro̜mə] Notes: ridge pole of a house.
[mɛ̣ɛ̣rəx] Quotation: “Leat an diugh ’nad aghaidh am màireach.” Notes: tomorrow.
[mɑɑ˖ɫ] Notes: bag of the pipe.
[mɑ:m siiçk] Notes: a rupture.
[mɑʂt mɤɤɫ] Notes: hornless cow.
[mɑ˖ʔəxəɣ] Notes: improvement.
[mɛ̃ɛ̃dɑ˖xk] Notes: size of an article, its dimensions.
[meuɣ] Notes: whey.
[mi̜ɫəɣ] Notes: to spoil.
[minʔəx] Quotation: am mineach. Notes: intestines in general.
[mɔ̣jʔəx] Notes: a hare. [NOTES: original spelling – moitheach.]
[mɔ̣̃ʔəs] Quotation: “Tha e mothas làn, trom, teth,” etc. Notes: excess of anything.
Quotation: muc a bearraich [muxkəbeərẹç]. Notes: porpoise.
[muilʹɑ̟r] Notes: a miller.
[mʊɫɑxɑɡ] Notes: a cheese.
[muɫɑ˖n] Notes: very large hayrick or of corn.
[muskʹən] [?] Notes: razorfish or spout-fish.
Quotation: ag ràin [əɡɑinʹ]. Notes: saying or speaking.
[rɑ̣̃˖içk] Notes: loud shout of uncouth nature.
[rɑ̃səɫ mo̜r] Notes: a horse drawn hay rake, also rasal each.
[rɑ˖ʔəd] Quotation: Thig iad a rathad dhaoine. Notes: to come to a peace.
[riəɣ] Notes: interest from money.
Notes: [rɔ̣h].
[rɔ̣xk] Notes: tangles: large species of seaweed which grows in deep water.
[rɔ̣nʹtʹəx] Notes: bracken.
[rɔ̣nʹəx] Notes: bracken.
[rɔɫɑɡən] Notes: rolls of wool produced after càrdadh.
[rɔ̣h] Notes: revolving wheel in a spinning wheel.
[ə rəxkəɣ] Notes: ricking hay.
[ruxk] Notes: hay rick.
[ruilʹə] [?] Notes: a reel or reel tune.
[ru:sk] Notes: bark of a tree.
[sic] [ɔ̣ɔ̣kʃəni̜ʔi̜rʹs]
Quotation: craobh chaoran [krööv xöörən]. Notes: rowan tree.
Notes: double variation in ceòl mór.
[ʃiuʔəɫ sinɡilʹtʹ] Notes: single variation in ceòl mór.
Quotation: na siùbhlaichean. Notes: the variations.
Quotation: an caol druim [əŋɡöldɾ̱ïm]. Notes: part of the back behind the shoulders.
[ɛsdə] Quotation: “a chuir asda”. Notes: out of them or in them.
[sɔ̣n] Quotation: air a shon sin ’s air fad.
[bɑ˖ncɑrʹs]
[ɑɑ˖d] Notes: them, 3rd Pers. Pl.
[ɑˈiəɫ] Notes: a thong of leather.
[i̜məlɑɡ] Notes: a round circle of wood, oak if in a cart.
[i̜məlɑkʹ] Notes: navel.
[ɪmiɾʹ xɾɑun] Notes: ivy.
[ɪṉəxiṉ] Notes: the brain.
[iʔɫəṉ] Notes: stack yard.
[inʹəltrəɣ] Notes: grazing.
Quotation: Chan ionann [xɑniənən] ’s mar a b’àbhaist. Notes: not the same as.
Quotation: ionnachan [iənəxən]. Notes: hank, hanks of wool.
[juusɪç] [?] Notes: towards.
[iʃən] Notes: young rabbit or bird.
[nɛɛpẹɡɑ̣˖nʹ] Notes: a handkerchief.
[nĩ] Quotation: Cha robh ni gréineadh ann. Notes: nothing.
Quotation: “Dar [dɑ˖r] tha thu falamh.”
[ɔ̣ʃnʹənʹ] [?] Notes: an outside corner of a house.
[ɔ:rɑ̣˖ʃ] Notes: nausea.
Notes: hammers in general.
[ɔ̣ʂdɑ˖] [?] Quotation: fo’n òrdagh. Notes: in orders (clerical).
[ɔ̣ɔ̣sDɑrən] Quotation: “’s nan osdairean air fad.” Notes: hoteliers.
[pɑʂtɑ˖nʹ] [?] Notes: small crabs.
Quotation: a’ pheircil [əɸerʹkilʹ]. Notes: lower jawbone.
[pɛərkəɫ ɑʂd] [?] Notes: upper jaw.
[pɛərkəɫ iiʃəɫ] Notes: lower jaw.
[peeʔinʹ] Quotation: Fhad s a bhios peighinn ’s a phoca cha chuir [?] an t-osdair cul riut.
[sic] Quotation: a’ phiob [əɸiḅ]. Notes: any tubular vessel; smoking pipe, water pipes or bracchia [sic] [bronchi?] or oesophagus.
[sic] an anail [pʹi̜i̜’b ən a̱na̱lʹ] Notes: bracchia [sic] [bronchi?].
[sic] Notes: a pipe without the largest one of the drones.
[sic] [piib vo̜r] Notes: bagpipe.
[sic] sheinn [pʹi̜i̜b hɤɤnʹ] Notes: bagpipe.
[sic] [piib hiəṉẹç] Notes: a chamber pipe. [NOTES: slipped under ‘pìob shìonaich’.]
Notes: ceol mor or classical bagpipe music.
[pɔ̣ɔ̣xkə] Notes: nominative and dative of pòca ‘pocket’.
[pɔ̣lʹəsmẹnʹ]
[pɔ̣ʂt] [?] Notes: any tune for play.
[pɔ̣ʂt tinʹɑ̟lʹ] [sic] Notes: a gathering tune.
Quotation: prabagan [prɑ˖bɑ̟ɡən]. Notes: very small ricks put up when hay is not dry enough to be ricked.
[priiʃən] Notes: prices.
[?] Notes: bard’s pieces for competition.
[puʂt trəum] Notes: single competitor’s pieces on the bagpipe.
Quotation: sabhal [sɑuɁəɫ]. Notes: barn.
Notes: ribwort plantain.
[sɑ˖lʹəɣ] Notes: salting, butter, fish etc.
[sic] [ʃɛəx] Notes: in comparison.
[ʃɛə̃ɣɑ˖n] Notes: an ant.
[ʃɛɑrəmɑ˖niçən] Notes: preachers.
[ʃɛlʹəx] Notes: willow tree.
Notes: black willow.
[sic] [ʃɛɑrəmɑnɑ̈xəɣ] Notes: preaching.
[skʊɾub̥ən] Notes: small swelling or growth.
Quotation: an sgabhan [əskɑ˖vɑ˖n]. Notes: the lungs. [NOTES: slipped under ‘sgamhan’.]
[skɛɛʼp] [?] Quotation: “sgeap bhechain,” “sgeap shelan”. Notes: a swarm of bees, also a bees’ hive.
[skilʹ] Notes: skill.
[skiʔəx] Notes: blackthorn.
[sklɛ̈nt] Quotation: gabhail sglent a mach. Notes: a short trip, cuairt bheag. [NOTES: slipped under ‘sgleant’.]
[skliɑ˖t] Notes: slate.
[skɔ̣ɔ̣N̪ɑ˖n̪] Notes: front part of neck.
[sɡrɑ˖h] Notes: brush wood or the word ad foliage of any small tree, usually calltuinn or beithe.
Quotation: a’ sgrathadh [ə skrɑ˖həɣ]. Notes: laying down a layer of scrath beneath the thatch of a building.
[sɡriib̥] Quotation: air sgrìob man cuairt. Notes: a trip to somewhere.
[skrɔ̣ɡəɡ] Quotation: a’ sgrogadh. Notes: hitting in a rough manner or chewing loudly.
[ʃi̜mɑ˖n sɡiəʔəɣ] Notes: the horizontal ropes on a thatched house.
[ʃi̜milʹẹrʹ] Notes: chimney.
Quotation: na sìnean [nəʃinʹən]. Notes: the teats.
[ʃiiəɫɑ˖xɑ˖n] [?] Notes: sieve.
[ʃiəɫəsdər] Notes: iris.
[ʃimɑ˖nɸrəəç] Notes: a heather rope made by twisting strands of long heather together. [NOTES: slipped under ‘sioman fraoich’.]
[ʃi̜mɑ˖n töiv] Notes: side ropes running horizontally along the roof parallel to the ridge and tied to specially projecting stones in the gable end. [NOTES: slipped under ‘sìoman taoibh’.]
[ʃimɑ˖n tɑ˖rsu̜nʹ] Notes: the vertical ropes on thatched house or a mullann [?]. [NOTES: slipped under ‘sìoman tarsuinn’.]
[ʃiisɑ˖r] Notes: scissor. [NOTES: slipped under ‘siosar’.]
Notes: the base of the horn where it enters the skull of a cow.
[sɫɑ̟ʔuk̥] Notes: cow’s horn.
Quotation: sliasaid, sleisdean [slʹiəsẹdʹ], [slʹẹẹsdʹən]. Notes: outside of the thigh.
Quotation: an t-sliasaid [əntliiəsɪtʹ]. Notes: front of thigh.
Quotation: an t slip iosal [ədɪli̜b̥iiʃəɫ]. Notes: lower lip. [NOTES: slipped under ‘sliop’.]
[smɛ̱ɔ̣rəx] Notes: sheep marking called a “fork”.
[smiɑrən] Notes: brambles.
Quotation: an smusail [əsmuʃɑ˖ɫ]. Notes: the height and width adjuster on a master tree. [NOTES: slipped under ‘smuiseal’.]
[snɑ:həd] Notes: a needle.
Notes: a darning needle.
[sọọrɑ˖xɑn] Notes: primrose.
[sɔ̣xk] Notes: the sock on a plough.
[söʔəx] Notes: any vessel for solids or liquids.
Quotation: soitheach an laoidh [söʔəxəlʹööç]. Notes: the womb.
Notes: a bundle of heather only or heather filling a hazel framework as a door.
[spɑɑ˖nʹ] Notes: a spoon or a spoonful.
[spɑrən] Notes: pieces of lumber which connect either side of the couples.
[spɛəɫ xröös] Notes: razor.
[spɛɛrəɣ] Notes: spare. [NOTES: slipped under ‘spèaradh’.]
[speirʹ] Notes: supranumerary digits on the [?] of a sheep’s hoof.
[spɔ̣ɡən] Notes: on a plough, handles of a plough.
[spu:d] Notes: diarrhoea in animals.
Quotation: an t srathair [əntrɑ˖hẹrʹ]. Notes: gen. is srathrach. The belt which is used as a girth.
[ʃrʹɛ̱ŋɡ] Notes: string.
[ʃrʹɛŋɡənən] Notes: strings or strands in a rope.
[srɛɛd̥] Notes: cattle, sheep, farm animals in general.
[stɑ˖ɑ˖buɫ] Notes: stable.
[stɑ˖mɑɡ] Notes: stomach of humans or in general.
[stɑiɸ] Notes: stem of the plant rochd. [NOTES: slipped under ‘stamh’.]
[ʃtʹẹẹ] [?] Quotation: stéidh or clach stéidh. Notes: foundation of house.
Quotation: stoc, stuic [stɔ̣xk, stuiçk]. Notes: part of pipe into which the dos goes and connects it to the màll.
Quotation: stuagh, stuathnan [stuɑ, stuəʔnən]. Notes: gable end of a house.
[su̟u̟ɡ̊ɑ˖n] Notes: a horse collar.
[suiʔəxəɣ] Quotation: a reir an suidheachadh ’s a robh iad. Notes: situation.
Quotation: sùil, sùilean [suuɫ, suuɫən]. Notes: eyes.
[sic] Quotation: [ʃuusdʹɑ̣˖n]. Notes: the part of a flail which strikes [?] the corn. [NOTES: slipped under ‘sùistean’.]
[ʃɤrk] Notes: shark.
Quotation: dol a’ sàs [dɔ̣̇ɫəsɑ̣˖ɑ̣˖s]. Notes: going up with, gripping strongly.
[ʃiənʃɑ̣˖r] Quotation: a practice chanter.
[tɑxkɑ˖n] Notes: small space of time.
[tɑijə] Notes: gen of tigh ‘a house’.
[tɑijən tuʔə] Notes: thatched houses.
[tɑɑ˖v] Notes: quiet, rest.
[töövɑ˖n] Notes: cross pieces which go between the couples of a roof on the outside, approx. 3 on either side.
Quotation: an taod. Notes: halter on a horse.
[tɤ:d̥] Notes: a tether in general.
[tɑ˖rən] Notes: any nail.
[tʹeuʔir] Notes: tether.
[tʹɛ̣uṉ] Notes: tight, mean or miserly, constipated.
Notes: phosphorescence.
[ɸɑ˖r]
[tii̜i̜əx] Quotation: an tioch. Notes: throat.
[təiç] Notes: a house.
[tinʹ]
[tɔ̣çkʹ] Notes: a swelling.
[tonʹəv] Quotation: a’ toineamh. Notes: twisting wool.
[t̪ɔ̣ʃkʹ] Notes: a swelling.
[tɔ̣̈ʃəx] Notes: beginning, front.
Notes: the tunnel on a plough.
[təuɫnəʃinə] Notes: orifice in teat.
Quotation: an tomhas ciorna [əndɔ̣ʔəskiərnə]. Notes: the same way as.
Quotation: torachan [tɔ̣rəxɑn]. Notes: long chisels for extracting stone.
[nətrəms] Notes: the trams on a cart. [NOTES: slipped under ‘tram’.]
[trɑ˖ʔən] Notes: lineal feet.
Quotation: a’ treabhadh [ətrɛuʔəɣ]. Notes: ploughing.
[trivilʹəx] Notes: ribwort, trefoil.
Quotation: seann triubhais. Notes: a traditional dance to a strathspey tune.
[trəç] Notes: foot rule.
[töörɫuə] Notes: doubling of tuarluadh.
[töörɫuə] Notes: penultimate part of ceòl mór.
Quotation: na Tuathaich [nə tuɑʔɪç]. Notes: the people of the northern and outer isles.
[tʊıɡʹʃinʹ] Quotation: “a’ leigeil a thuigsinn an cumhachd a bh’aca.”
[tʊilʹiç] Quotation: Ged bhiodh an tuilleadh ann dhiubh ’se b’fheàrr.
[tulʹiç] Quotation: “Tha e tuillidh is trom, mor, leathann, etc.” Notes: excess of anything.
[tʊiṉʹəxəɣ] [?] Notes: milk curdling in the udder.
[ũɑ̃rẹj] Notes: ‘very’. [NOTES: slipped under ‘uamhraidh’.]
[?] [uʔəɫ ə skɔ̣ɔ̣ nɑ̣˖nʹ] Notes: “Adam’s apple.”
Quotation: an t-uchd [əntʊxk]. Notes: the chest.
Quotation: [ən uuc] [?]. Notes: the udder.
[uunʹə] Notes: time. (Noun.)
[uunʹəxk] Quotation: [dɑ˖ huunʹəxk]. Notes: time (dat.).
[ʊinʹəxk] Quotation: fad na h-uineachd. Notes: genitive of ùine.
[ɤ:ʃinʹ] Notes: ash tree.
[uurʹ] Notes: earth, soil.
[ʊrɫɑ˖r] Notes: “ground” of the ceòl mór.
[uurɫɑ˖r buəlẹç] Notes: a threshing floor in a barn.
[ursənən] Notes: the jambs of the door.
[ɑ̟:wẹʃtʹ]
[ɑ˖xkɑ̣˖nʹ] Notes: equipment for yoking a horse, tools [?] of any kind.
[ö:rkɑ˖n] Notes: a peewit.
[öʔəç] Quotation: “tighinn air aghaidh”.
[ɑiç] Quotation: “móran àigh bhuapa”.
Quotation: an ainin [ən ɑ̣˖nʹi̜nʹ]. Notes: the eaves of a house.
[nə hɑ̣˖ʃnʹən] Notes: the ribs. [NOTES: slipped under ‘aisean’.]
[ɑ̣ʃẹlʹ] Notes: axle. [NOTES: slipped under ‘aisil’.]
[ɑ˖ɫt] Notes: a joint in the bone structure.
Quotation: an t amal [əntɑ˖məɫ]. Notes: master trees, airson cliath a cheathal ris na greallagan.
[ɑ˖wʔɪç] Notes: the neck.
Quotation: far an aodainn [ɤdɑ̟:nʹ]. Notes: front, forefront.
[ööɫ] Notes: lime for use as a mortar.
[öötrəmɑ˖n] Notes: bladder.
Quotation: an asgraidh [ən ɑsɡrẹj]. Notes: to tie a cow, equivalent of “ceangal”.
[bɑ˖xkɑ˖n ɑɑ˖ʂd] Notes: sheep marking called fore half.
[bɑ˖xkɑ˖n kuulʹ] Notes: sheep marking called “back half”.
[sic] Quotation: a’ chiad bhaine [ə çiəd vɑinʹə]. Notes: first milk after the birth. [NOTES: slipped under ‘bainne’.]
[bɑɑ˖rnʹiç] Notes: limpets. [NOTES: slipped under ‘bàirneach’.]
[bɑ˖ɫə] Notes: wall of a house.
[bɑṉɑ˖n] Notes: hinges for hanging a door.
[bɑn-lọrɡ] Notes: the portion of the flail held in the hand.
[bɑ˖rlʹə] Notes: barrel; a measure for fish, potatoes.
[bɑɑ˖r] Notes: sheep marking called ‘crop’.
[bɑɑ˖r dɛrɡ] Notes: rochd which comes ashore in May time.
[bɑ̟:ʔiç] Notes: a byre.
Quotation: beathach cruidh [be̜u̜xkr̥u̜˖ç]. Notes: cattle beast.
Quotation: a breith air [ə bɾe̜ eɾ]. Notes: catching hold of.
[bẹẹm] Notes: sheep marking called “bit”.
[ɸẹr] Notes: infinitive of abair.
Quotation: a’ bhann [ə vɑuṉ].
Quotation: a’ bheoil [ə ve̱ɔ̣ɔ̣l]. Notes: gen. of bial.
Quotation: a’ bhriogais [ə vrikʹẹʃ]. Notes: used as brake for the cart passed under the horse’s tail.
Quotation: a’ bhrolain [əveɾɔ̣̈lʹha̱nʹ] [?]. Notes: 2nd stomach of cow.
[vuɑxə] Quotation: “móran àigh bhuapa”. Notes: from them.
[bi̜əɣ] Notes: food of any classification.
[biɑɫ ɑɑ˖ʂd] Notes: upper palate.
[biɑɫ iiʃəɫ] Notes: lower part of mouth.
[biəstɑɡ] Notes: a worm.
[bẹʃt ɣu] Notes: an otter.
[biərɑ˖n] Notes: any small stick.
Quotation: am bitheantas [əmbiçəʔntəs]. Notes: usually, most often.
[sic] Quotation: a’ blàteachadh [ə bɫɑ̟ɑ̟tʹəxəɣ]. Notes: heating, warming something.
Quotation: a’ bleoghain [ə blʹẹəʔẹnʹ]. Notes: milking a cow, sheep or horse.
[bo̜ksə] Notes: any square object, a box.
Quotation: bocsa na cartach. Notes: part of cart which is surrendered by the sides.
Notes: ribwort plantain.
[bɔ̣:ʂtskɛṉ] Notes: a table for sharpening knives on; bath brick was rubbed on it to sharpen them.
[brɑ˖dɑ˖n] Notes: an inflamed area caused by the swelling of a vein or capillaries.
[b̥rɑ˖məstɑ˖ɡən] Notes: burrs.
[brɤɤnɑ˖n] Notes: marigold.
[b̥ɾɑ˖htɑ˖ɡ] Notes: large black hairy caterpillar.
[brẹẹtʹ] Notes: any piece of cloth.
[breetʹ kɑɑ˖ʃə] Notes: a cheese cloth.
[briʃkɑ̣˖nʹ] Notes: silver weed.
[buəxəɾ] Notes: manure.
[buɑlʹ] Notes: stall for one cow.
[buəlʹtʹẹn] Notes: the striking portion of a flail.
Quotation: a’ bualadh [ə buələɣ]. Notes: to thresh corn.
Quotation: bualtan [buəltɑ˖n] (buidhe). Notes: yellow ribwort, gives yellow dye.
[bujə] Notes: yellow.
[bulʹ] Quotation: gu bhuill fhein. Notes: profit [?] use.
Quotation: Tha sinach an càran [əŋɡ̊ɑɑrʹɑ̈ṉ]. Notes: the gum. [NOTES: slipped under ‘càirean’.]
[kɑ˖ʂt] Quotation: a cart for a horse. [NOTES: slipped under ‘cairt’.]
Quotation: na cartach [nə kɑ˖ʂtəx]. Notes: gen. of cart. [NOTES: slipped under ‘cairt’.]
[kɑuntɑ˖rɑxk] Notes: pipe music produced by humming.
[kəənʹəxəɣ] Quotation: a’ caoineachadh. Notes: drying hay.
Quotation: an caol druim [əŋɡöl dṟɪ̈m] [sic]. Notes: part of the back behind the shoulders.
Quotation: an caolan geal [əɡɯ̜iɯ̜iɫɑnɡʹiɑɫ]. Notes: rectum.
Quotation: caolain [kʹɯ̟ɯ̟ɫɑ˖nʹ]. Notes: intestines of an animal.
Quotation: craobh chaoran [krööv xöörən]. Notes: rowan tree.
Quotation: na càrdan [nə kɑɑ˖ʂdən]. Notes: carding combs.
Quotation: a’ càrdadh [ə kɑɑ˖ʂdəɣ(ɡ)]. Notes: carding.
Quotation: càrn [kɑɑ˖ɾn] chlach. Notes: sledge for drawing stone after a horse, 3 to 4 wide.
[kɑ˖riɡʹinʹ] Notes: carrigean [sic].
[kɑ˖ʂtɑ˖n] Notes: a tick.
Quotation: na casan deirich [nə kɑ˖sɑ dʹërʹɪç]. Notes: rear legs.
Quotation: na casan toisich [nə kɑ˖sɑ˖ tɔ̣ʃiç]. Notes: forelegs.
Quotation: casan na cuibhleadh [kɑ˖sɑ˖n nɑ kuiləɡ]. Notes: 3 legs of a spinning wheel.
[kʹɛhtəl] Notes: a kettle.
Quotation: an ceann [əŋɡɛ̜ʊn]. Notes: the head.
[keɑṉəx] Notes: buying.
[kɛṉɑ˖ɡ] Notes: a bundle of straw only.
[ke̜rkəɫ] Quotation: cearcall cartach. Notes: the iron tyre on the outside of a cart wheel.
[kẹẹʂdəx] Notes: smithy.
Quotation: an ceathramh deirich [ən keɑʔrɑ˖v dʹẹʔrʹiç]. Notes: hind quarter of an animal.
Quotation: an ceathramh toisich [ən kreɑʔrɑ˖v tɔ̣ʃiç] [sic]. Notes: fore-quarter of an animal.
[sic] beag [kʹɛ̣ɔ̣ɫ bek] Notes: comprises march, strathspey and reel.
[kɛ̣ɔ̣ɫ dɑ˖usẹj] [sic] Notes: tunes for dancing.
[sic] Notes: any marching tune.
[xɑiç] Notes: went, used in normal speech.
[xɑiʔiç] Notes: went, used in answer to a question.
Notes: wooden harrows.
Quotation: a’ chorp [əxɔ̣̈rp]. Notes: the body in general, also the stomach and intestines.
Quotation: a’ chrois [əxrɔ̣ʃ]. Notes: instrument for making hanks of wool.
Quotation: a’ chruachan [əxruɑ̈xɑ˖n]. Notes: thigh or the back of the thigh.
Notes: foxglove.
[kirʹ] Notes: comb for teasing out as it passes on to the roth.
Quotation: an cìr [ənɡʹiiɾʹ]. Notes: the cud.
Quotation: a’ cìreadh [ə kirʹəɣ(ɡ)]. Notes: teasing the wool.
Notes: stone on which the rope was tied at the side of the house.
[kɫɑ˖xɑ̣˖rəxk] Notes: masonry.
Quotation: clachan risnean [?]. Notes: corner stones.
Quotation: an claigeann [əxɫɑ˖ɡʹən]. Notes: the skull.
[kɫɑikʹən] Notes: the support for the birne [?] which holds the wool.
Quotation: clàr an aodainn [kɫɑɑ˖rənɤɤdẹnʹ]. Notes: forehead.
[kɫɑ˖rẹj] Notes: a partition inside the house.
Quotation: na cliadhaichean [nə klʹiəħẹçən]. Notes: the sides of a cart.
Quotation: a’ chliath, cliathan [kliɑhən]. Notes: harrows.
[kɫɔ̣xk] Notes: a growth, swelling in an animal’s throat.
Quotation: a’ chloich [ə xɫɔ̣iç]. Notes: the wool. [NOTES: slipped under ‘clòidh’.]
Quotation: cnaimh an droma [k̥ɾɑ̃ĩvəndrọmə]. Notes: spine.
Quotation: cnaimh an t-slinein [krɑ̃ĩvəntlʹinʹɑ̣˖nʹ]. Notes: the shoulder blade.
Quotation: cnaimh an uchd [kɾɑ̃ĩvənʊxk]. Notes: breast bone.
Quotation: cnaimh an urabail [kɾɑ̃ĩvənurəbulʹ]. Notes: tail bone.
Quotation: cnaimh urlar nam port. Notes: the framework of the ground.
Quotation: a’ cnàmh [ɑ kɾɑɑ˖v]. Notes: digesting or wasting away.
[kɔ̣lʹən vɑ˖rɑ˖] Notes: sea urchin.
[kɔ̣nɑ˖n mɑ˖rɑ˖] Notes: sea urchin.
[kọɫtẹrʹe] [sic] Notes: the coulter on a plough.
Quotation: conachagan [kɔ̣nɑxɑɡən]. Notes: snails.
[kɔ̣nəsk] Notes: whin.
[kɔ̣nəvələx] Notes: a disaster.
[kɔ̣̃ɫẹç] Notes: straw of corn or wheat. [NOTES: slipped under ‘connlach’.]
[ko̜pəɫ] Quotation: copal [ko̜pəɫ], cupal [kupəɫ]. Notes: couple in the roof of a house.
[kɔ̣r-hu̜ɡɑn] Notes: a round sickle shaped object for making straw ropes.
[kɔ̣r-hʊɫəxẹnʹ] Notes: the part which is the triangle of the gable, is sloped towards the roof and forms part of it. Used in thatch and slate roofs.
[kɔ̹sɫəx] Quotation: coslach beathaich. Notes: skeleton of an animal.
[krɑ˖xkɑ˖n] Notes: small space of time.
[krɑuxkɑ˖n] Notes: any rough lump or piece of wood. [NOTES: slipped under ‘cranchdan’.]
[krɑuṉ] Notes: a plough.
[krɑuṉ iuʔə] Notes: wooden plough. [NOTES: slipped under ‘crann-fhiodha’.]
Notes: steel or iron plough. [NOTES: slipped under ‘crann-iaruinn’.]
[krɑundɑ̣˖rən] Notes: wooden pins used in place of nails.
Quotation: (slige) creachain [krɛ̣əxɑnʹ]. Notes: clam or clam shell.
[krɛ̣ʔəɣ] Notes: clay: gen. and dat. of criadh.
[kreçk] Notes: selling.
Quotation: a’ crechd [ɑˈkre̜xk]. Notes: selling an article. [NOTES: slipped under ‘creic’.]
[krẹẹlɑ˖ɡ] Notes: a horse fly.
[kriɑ˖] Notes: clay.
Notes: blue clay.
[kriəhər] Notes: an instrument for separate [sic] grain and chaff, a sieve.
Quotation: an cridhe [əŋɡrʹiiʔə]. Notes: the heart.
[krʹimɑ˖n] Notes: a little distance or space.
[krihʔəṉ] Notes: aspen tree.
[krɔ̣̈ɡ] Notes: large earthenware vessel like a jar for most liquids, principally milk.
[krɔ̣̃nəxəɣ] Quotation: “air a chronachadh” – bewitched. Notes: bewitching.
[kruuḅɑnʹ] Notes: large crabs.
[kruib] Notes: a piece of wood running down inside the wall on which the lannain rested.
Quotation: crunluadh breabach [krunluə bẹẹbəx]. Notes: singling of crunluadh.
Quotation: crunluadh fosgailte [krunluə ɸɔ̣sɡẹltʹ]. Notes: first crunluadh.
Quotation: crunluadh mach. Notes: doubling of crunluadh and the final part of ceòl mòr.
Quotation: crunluadh singilte. Notes: singling of crunluadh.
[krʊɫuɑ] Notes: last part of ceòl mòr. [NOTES: slipped under ‘crùnluadh’.]
[kuəx hi̜mɑ˖nʹ] Notes: ceithir luba fichead eadar do chasan agus do chaol-druim. [NOTES: slipped under ‘cuach shìomain’.]
[krɔhtəɫ] Notes: grey lichen, makes a brown die.
[kruəx] Quotation: cruach (fheoir). Notes: a rick of hay shaped like so and thatched on top.
[k̥udəɾəm] Notes: weight.
[kuiʔəɫ] Notes: spinning wheel.
[kuilʹəɣ] Quotation: ’gad chuibhleadh air falbh. Notes: forcible removal or genitive of cuibheal. Also [kuilʹək].
[kuilʹkʹ] Notes: bull-rushes.
Notes: a midge.
Quotation: cuiseanan [kʊʃənən]. Notes: arteries.
Quotation: cùl nan adharcan [kuuɫ nən öörkʹən]. Notes: back of skull [?].
[kuuɫɑ˖ɡən] Notes: molars.
Notes: a lament on the bagpipes.
[kuʔəxk] Quotation: “a leigeil a thuigsinn an cumhachd a bh’aca.” Notes: power.
[kuurn] Notes: churn for making butter.
[kurniçən] Notes: churns (pl.).
[kʊɾəxk ə rʹɪɪ] Notes: 3rd stomach of cow. [NOTES: slipped under ‘currac-a-rìgh’.]
[kʊrəxknəkuʔhɑiɡʹ] Notes: ragged robin. [NOTES: slipped under ‘currachd na cuthaig’.]
[dɑ̟: xlʹẹsɑ˖n] Notes: bicycle.
Notes: window with a bundle of heather or straw in place of wood and glass. [NOTES: slipped under ‘dall uinneag’.]
[dɑ̃vɑn ɑlʹi̜] Notes: a spider.
Notes: sword dance; danced to the tune “Gille Calum”.
Notes: oak tree.
[dʹɑɫɑn dʹẹ] Notes: a butterfly.
[dʹɛəɫəɡ] Notes: a knitting pin especially for socks.
[dʹɛərɡən trɑ˖ʔəd] Notes: sand fleas.
[dʹe̜e̜sɡɑ˖nʹ] Notes: rennet used to curdle milk.
[dʹẹʎəɣ kuəçəɣ] [?] Notes: a rounded stern as on a skiff.
[dʹiəɫẹt] Notes: a saddle.
[dʹiəltɑ˖ɡ] Notes: a bat.
[di:ʔɑ̣˖nʹ] Notes: daisy.
[dʹiʔɑ̣˖nʹ] Notes: daisy.
Quotation: an diosgadh [sic] [dʹiiəsɡəɣ]. Notes: going farrow (of a cow).
[d̥ɔ̣ʔərxuu] Notes: a dog otter.
[dɔ̣̃inəxk] Notes: depth.
Quotation: an domblas [ədọ˖məɫɑ̈s]. Notes: the bile duct or gall bladder.
[dɔ̣rəst] Quotation: “gabh an dorus”.
[dɔ̣rəst] Notes: opening for a door.
Notes: large drone of bagpipe.
[dɔ̣sɡẹj] Notes: rough grazing, rough long grass.
[dɔ̣hterẹn]
[drɛhən] Notes: hawthorn.
[driʃən] Notes: any briar.
[drıuxk] Notes: dew. [NOTES: slipped under ‘driùchd’.]
Quotation: an dromanach [əndrọmɑnɑx]. Notes: the strap which supported the trams on to the horse.
[drɔ̣˖mɑnɑx] Notes: elderberry tree.
[drɪɪm] Notes: the frame on a plough.
[duəɫ] Notes: a strand in any rope, e.g. heather rope.
[dulʹəskʹ] Notes: dulse.
Quotation: na duis bheaga. Notes: the small drone.
[duʔəv] Quotation: a’ duitheamh. Notes: extracting stone.
[ẹdər sɡɔ̣h] Notes: a middle sized skiff about 12 to 14 feet long.
[iɑɫɔ̣nʹ] Notes: ivy.
[eeʔən] Notes: ivy tree.
Notes: hazel.
[ɛəɫtẹnʹ] Notes: scissor or a bird flock, also razor.
[ɛərəɫəs] Quotation: “Bi t’earalas air a pholisman.”
[ʊrəbʊ̈ɫ(ə)] Notes: tail. [NOTES: slipped under ‘earball’.]
[ʊrəbi̜lʹ] Notes: gen. of urball. [NOTES: slipped under ‘earball’.]
[e:rəbsə] Quotation: Nach eil math dhuit earbsa a chuir asda.
[ẹ̇ẹ̇ʃəx] Notes: a belt which when yoked for a machine or light cart passed under the tail and joined the srathair on a horse.
[ɛɔ̣ɫẹs krɔ̣̃nəxẹç] Notes: knowledge of witchcraft; witchcraft.
[ɛ̣ɛ̣r] Notes: air.
[ɸɑxəx] Notes: a mole.
[ɸɑktɑ˖rʹ] Notes: factors.
[ɸɑd] Quotation: air a shon sin ’s air fad.
Notes: a salute on the bagpipe.
[ɸɑɫəv] Quotation: Dar tha thu falamh. Notes: short of money.
[ɸəundɑ̱˖nʹ] Notes: thistles.
[ɸɑ˖rəɣ] Notes: a small platform usually reserved for hens above the cattle, in a thatched byre.
[fɑ̟rənəx] Notes: a delay, stoppage.
Quotation: a’ fàsgadh [ə ɸɑɑ˖sɡəɣ]. Notes: pressing or squeezing.
[ɸɑ˖sɡɑ˖nɑ˖ɡ] Notes: a round instrument similar to a criathar for separating the chaff.
Quotation: an fheadag [əŋẹdɑɡ]. Notes: the green plover. Said to whistle 24 hours before a storm.
[ɸẹẹdɑ˖n] Notes: chanter on which fingers produce music.
[ɸẹẹdɑ˖n] Notes: a practice chanter.
[ɸe̱u̜˖ʔi̜nʹ] Notes: some.
[ɸɛəmɑ̣˖nʹ vujə] Notes: bladder wrack. [NOTES: slipped under ‘feamainn bhuidhe’.]
Quotation: an fheamain chirein [ənɛəmẹ˖nʹ çi̜rʹɑ̣˖nʹ]. Notes: serrated wrack. [NOTES: slipped under ‘feamainn chirein’.]
Quotation: a’ feanadh [əɸɛ̱ṉəɣ]. Notes: skinning an animal.
Quotation: an fhear [än ɛ̜r]. Notes: the one, the man.
Quotation: an fhearna [ən ɛɛrnə]. Notes: the alder tree, gives a black dye.
Quotation: an fhearsaid [ən ɛərsẹdʹ]. Notes: spindle for twisting wool.
[ɸiɑsɡɑ˖nʹ] Notes: mussels.
Quotation: fhéin [hẹẹ].
[ɸe̱ʔəv̥] Quotation: De feitheamh a th’ort? Notes: watching, observing (very rarely waiting for).
[ɸɔ̣lʹəɣ] Quotation: foileadh de dh obair. Notes: useless work. [NOTES: slipped under ‘(f)eocladh’.]
[ɸiəɾəs əvɑ̟inʹə] Notes: milk fever.
[ɸiɣʔɑ˖n] Notes: butter pat.
[ɸiəɣɑ˖n] Notes: small box with holes used for compressing crowdie.
[fisəxk] Notes: knowledge of the supernatural.
[ɸiʔəɡ/ɣ] Notes: knitting.
[ɸiuʔər] Quotation: ’S e’d a ni ’n fhiughar riut. Notes: welcome, anticipation.
[ɸiəɫɑ˖n] Notes: a beetle of any kind.
[ɸrəəx] Notes: heather as a dying agent gives a yellow colour or with indigo gives green.
[ɸrööx mɛkʹɑ̣˖nʹ] Notes: bell heather.
[ɸrɑ˖ʔuṉ]
Quotation: na fruisg [nɑ˖ ɸruʃkʹ]. Notes: the eyes.
[ɸudẹrʹ] Notes: powder for blasting.
Quotation: nach gabhadh [ɡɑuʔəɣ]. Notes: it could not be.
[ɡɑɑ˖ɫtəxk]
Quotation: a’ Ghàidhlig [ɑɣɑɑ˖lʹikʹ].
[ɡɑɑ˖lʹjəx] Notes: small growth on cow’s gum.
[ɡɑ̣˖lʹɛrəx] Notes: willow; weeping willow, long thin green withies.
[ɡɑ˖ɫɑ˖rʹ] [NOTES: slipped under ‘galar’.]
[ɡɑ̟ɫɑ̟rxruiç] Notes: foot-and-mouth disease.
[ɡɑũṉə] Notes: gen of gamhuin, a stirk.
[ɡɤ̈ɤ̈ʔərʹə] Notes: part of bagpipe placed in mouth to blow into.
[ɡɑ˖ɾəvɑ̈k] Notes: means large thick flounder.
[ɡɤ̈rət] Notes: thickness.
[ɡɑɑ˖ʂtʹɑ̣˖n] Notes: forearm in humans.
[CAD] [sic] Quotation: “ged bhiodh”.
[ɡʹiəʔnʹən] Notes: [?] wedges or large chisels.

[ɡʹilʹəxə ɡʹiɑɫə] Notes: white periwinkles.
[ɡʹimiç] Notes: lobsters.
[ɡiʃrɑ̟ɡɑn] Notes: superstitions.
Quotation: an glanadh [əŋ ɡɫɑ˖nəɣ]. Notes: the afterbirth or the covering over the foetus.
[ɡlʹẹsɑn] Notes: rod or thong which is connected to treadle.
[ɡɫẹʔəɣ] or [ɡɫẹʔək] Quotation: “a’ gleidheadh sìth”.
[ɡlees] Notes: reed inside the chanter.
[ɡlʹẹsəɣ] Notes: general word for tuning a pipe.
[ɡɫɑ˖sɑ̣˖dʹ] Notes: clod which goes along the top of the wall beneath and outside the thatch.
Quotation: an globhair [əŋ ɡlɔvɑ̣˖rʹ]. Notes: clover.
Quotation: an glùn [ɑŋɡɫuun]. Notes: the knee. [NOTES: slipped under ‘glùin’.]
Quotation: an goinigear [ə ɡɔ̣̈nʹiɡʹər]. Notes: the supernumerary digits at the back of a cow’s hoof.
[ɡɔ̣̈rəm] Notes: the colour green.
[ɡɔ̣˖ʂtɑ˖xəɣ] Notes: harm, hurt.
Quotation: an gothach [ən ɡɔ̣ʔəx]. Notes: the reed inside the bagpipe drone.
[ɡrɑɑ˖pə] Notes: a grape for digging.
[ɡrɛɫɑ˖ɡən] Notes: swingle trees on a plough.
[ɡrɛɸ] Notes: garlic.
[ɡrèmiçə] Notes: same as a [ɡrɑ̀pɑ]. [NOTES: note added in different hand – ‘grèimige (?)’.]
Quotation: an grothain [ə ɡrɔ̣̈ʔɑ˖nʹ]. Notes: split hoof of an ungulate.
Quotation: an gruth [əŋ ɡ̊rʊ]. Notes: crowdie.
Quotation: an grùthan [əŋɡ̃ruu-ɑ˖n]. Notes: the liver.
Quotation: a’ ghualain [əɣuɑlʹẹnʹ]. Notes: the shoulder.
Quotation: gucagan. Notes: wild roses.
[ɡurɑ̣˖nʹ] Notes: a pimple.
